main event: On October 7, 1955, in northwest of San Angelo, Texas, observers reported seeing a reddish-orange fireball the size of a dime, leaving a white smoke trail, followed by a blazing light descending steadily. However, the area was searched with no results.
interesting points: The observed fireball was described as the size of a dime held at arm's length, indicating it was relatively large and bright.
The object left a white smoke trail for approximately five seconds, suggesting it was a significant and observable event.

Two jet fighters engaged what appeared to be two unidentified high-speed targets, but both targets disappeared from radar simultaneously and then apparently blew up, with no wreckage found in the area.
Several witnesses reported seeing a bright orange object streak across the sky followed by a bright flash and sudden disappearance, adding to the mysterious circumstances.
The report mentions multiple similar incidents reported at the base within the past year, all involving unidentified aircraft or objects disappearing under mysterious circumstances.
sighted object: reddish-orange fireball, blazing light, unidentified high-speed targets
witnesses: observers, jet fighter pilots, witnesses in the vicinity
